summary:
Agile consultant and expert in Kanban.

My mission is to free people from overburdening so they can do what they like to do the most.

I'm convinced that results are achieved by choosing the most effective and impactful changes guided by insights based on an empirical description. This results in organisations that learn to adapt and change in a humane way.

Specialties: Kanban method, 15+ years of knowledge and experience in Agile methodologies and practices, applying systems thinking to discover impactful interventions, data science

certifications.name: Fit for Purpose framework
certifications.authority: David J Anderson School of Management

company.name: David J Anderson School of Management

publications.name: Evolutionary change. Where do I start?
Probabilistic forecasting using empirical task data for a Lean process
Higher Order QCD Corrections to Timelike Processes

profile_positions.description: Implementation of a system to measure the business benefits that result from improvements by setting up the metrics and guiding the organisation in the use of these. This includes planning and forecasting on ART level (SAFe). I do this in the role of a metrics expert
profile_positions.title: Agile Consultant / Metrics expert [through KPMG/Xebia]

profile_positions.description: Within the HR department I automated a significant part of the employee onboarding process involving manual labor resulting in happier employees and significant improvement of quality (no errors) and time (from 15-30 minutes per transaction to less than 5 minutes).
profile_positions.title: RPA Developer

profile_positions.description:
Analysing the dependency data for a marketing department with 80 teams in 4 tribes. The data is extracted from the (SAFe) PI planning and visualised. This demonstrated the complexity providing the Management Team with valuable insights into the impact of the complexity resulting in actions from the MT to reduce this complexity.

Set-up Jira for a complex project with many internal as well as external and various suppliers. This resulted in (a) a transparent overview of the progress, status and impediments, and (b) an easy to maintain implementation while at the same time preserving freedom to the teams ensuring their independence.
profile_positions.title: Kanban Consultant

profile_positions.description: I had the privilege of guiding the organisation in the next steps of their continuous improvement journey. This results in an increase of focus on realising strategic goals, maintaining a sustainable pace for business teams using kanban, and extending the continuous improvement from team to organisational level.
profile_positions.title: Agile Consultant

profile_positions.description:
In the role of a Kanban Consultant training, consulting and guiding the DevOps department in applying kanban to achieve their strategic goals.

Agile / Kanban consulting with management in various parts of the organisation.
profile_positions.title: Kanban Consultant

profile_positions.description: Advising the management team to start with an evolutionary approach focussing on business results through continuous transformation. The resulted in a proposal for building upon the current achievements to achieve measurable business impact.
profile_positions.title: Agile/DevOps Consultant [through Xebia]

profile_positions.description:
In the role of an Agile coach part of the Agile transformation of KPN Network. In this role I supported a tribe consisting of some 20 teams. The challenge was to balance the operational responsibilities and quality of service with innovating the way of working. The key results have been:
* stability in way of working while maintaining operational quality levels,
* alignment between teams on backlogs and common roadmap that supports the strategy,
* supported the tribe in the assurance of continuous improvements.
profile_positions.title: Agile consultant [through Xebia]

profile_positions.description:
As an Agile consultant within KPN Networks in a challenging environment to maintain the balance between operational service levels and innovating on the way of working supported two business units, each of 5 (scrum) teams with key results that within 6 months time:
* together with the teams we found a way to get the benefits from Scrum while still making it work in their challenging environment with the result that the department incorporated continuous innovation and improvement within the existing responsibilities,
* by introducing a kanban-system for their products in an environment with many dependencies the infrastructure department achieved predictability towards their clients for the migration of networks.
profile_positions.title: Agile consultant [through Xebia]

profile_positions.description:
In the role of an Agile coach support two business units that have both operational and development responsibilities. Both units have been already using Scrum as a way of working Agile. The assignment was two-fold: coach the teams in finding ways of working that better suit their environment, and set-up an environment for incorporating continuous improvement in the (daily) way of working. The improvements are on business unit level and need the cooperation of several teams to complete. The key results are:
* acceleration of the development of new features,
* 4 to 5 improvements done per month on business unit level,
* using a kanban-system for creating a continuous flow of starting and finishing improvements,
* balancing the improvement work with the new feature development and operational work.
profile_positions.title: Agile consultant [through Xebia]

profile_positions.description:
In the role of Agile coach the assignment was to support two business units in use of Agile. Both departments work together with large external consultancy organisations in both off-shore and near-shore. Key results are:
* Matured teams in their predictability and use of Scrum so it fits their environment and making the next step in portfolio management possible,
* Supported the implementation of a SAFe portfolio wall and helped to set-up a successful PI planning,
* Assurance of continuous agile transformation by creating a story map of the transformation and coaching internal KPN coaches in their new role.
profile_positions.title: Agile consultant [through Xebia]

profile_positions.description:
In the role of an Agile coach supported the implementation of SAFe to a sustainable level. In this role I:
* set-up the market place on portfolio level for the whole organisation,
* supported the execution of the PI events with the result that ,
* supported the internal Agile coaches in coaching the organisation on SAFe.
profile_positions.title: Agile consultant [through Xebia]

profile_positions.description:
In the role of an Agile coach within the infrastructure environment support existing Scrum teams in their Agile journey. The challenging part of the assignment is to help the teams to find a way of working that works for them in their operational environment with many dependencies. The key results are:

* enhancing the organisational coaching capability by coaching an internal coach in his next steps,
* assurance of (Agile) knowledge sharing by setting up a monthly Agile community, OpenSpace style,
* assured continuous improvement by setting up a structure and mindset for continuously performing assessments to identify opportunities and improvements,
* predictable teams towards business departments by setting up a flow system (kanban system) that balances various work types have different risk categories,
* together with the management team set-up an Obeya board for better decision making.
profile_positions.title: Agile consultant [through Xebia]

profile_positions.description:
My assignment was to support 2 teams in their (already started) journey with Agile/Scrum. Part of the assignment was to assess the teams on Agile/Scrum and help them identify next steps. The main result of this assessment were:
* identified list of strengths, weaknesses, threats, and opportunities (SWOT),
* advice in terms of concrete actions for next steps in reaching their goals,
* negotiated set of actions to take first.
profile_positions.title: Agile consultant [through Xebia]

profile_positions.description:
In the role of an Agile coach my assignment was 2-fold: within the R&D department support the teams in their Agile transformation, and perform an assessment for assuring a continuing transformation. The key results are:
* by performing an assessment of the R&D department defined actions (short-term) and (long-term) to improve further there execution of the business strategy,
* using a portfolio wall (kanban style) the teams are more focused in building the right features to support the business strategy,
* as a direct result of the coaching and the enthusiasm within R&D, this initiated action within the product management department to also start with Agile.
profile_positions.title: Agile consultant [through Xebia]

volunteer_experiences.description: I coordinated any news and content related to the website and participated in the communications committee.
Coordinating all supporting activities around the youth soccer team.
